contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox Australian place | type = town | name = Rockbank | city = Melbourne | state = vic | image = RockbankCommunityHall.JPG | caption = | lga = Shire of Melton Mayor = Shaun Wilson- King | postcode = 3335 | pop = 1,349 (2011)<ref name="abs">{{Census 2011 AUS | id = SSC21157 | name = Rockbank (State Suburb) | accessdate = 1 July 2007 | quick = on}}</ref> | est = | elevation= 116 | alternative_location_map = Australia Victoria metropolitan Melbourne | latd =37 |latm =44|lats = | longd =144|longm =40|longs = | pushpin_map_caption = Location in metropolitan Melbourne | stategov = [[Electoral district of Melton|Melton]] | fedgov = [[Division of Gorton|Gorton]] | dist1 = 29 | location1= [[Melbourne]] | dist2 = 10 | location2= [[Melton, Victoria|Melton]] | near-nw = [[Melton, Victoria (suburb)|Melton]] | near-n = | near-ne = [[Plumpton, Victoria|Plumpton]] | near-w = [[Melton South, Victoria|Melton South]] | near-e = [[Caroline Springs, Victoria|Caroline Springs]] | near-sw = [[Mount Cottrell, Victoria|Mount Cottrell]] | near-s = [[Truganina, Victoria|Truganina]] | near-se = [[Ravenhall, Victoria|Ravenhall]] }} '''Rockbank''' is a township and rural locality in [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]], 29 km west of Melbourne's [[Melbourne City Centre|Central Business District]]. Its [[Local government areas of Victoria|local government area]] is the [[Shire of Melton]]. At the [[Census in Australia#2011|2011 Census]], Rockbank had a population of 1,349. Rockbank Post Office opened on 1 January 1862.<ref name = "a">{{Cite web | last = Premier Postal History | title = Post Office List | url = https://www.premierpostal.com/cgi-bin/wsProd.sh/Viewpocdwrapper.p?SortBy=VIC&country= | accessdate = 11 April 2008 | postscript = <!-- Bot inserted parameter. Either remove it; or change its value to "." for the cite to end in a ".", as necessary. -->{{inconsistent citations}} }}</ref> The area lies east of the township of [[Melton, Victoria|Melton]] and west of the suburb of [[Deer Park, Victoria|Deer Park]]. The land contains many large [[volcano|volcanic]] rocks making it poor for cultivating crops. The rocks have been used to build walls between paddocks - characteristic of the area west of Melbourne. [[Mount Cottrell, Victoria|Mount Cottrell]] is the highest land point in the vicinity. The [[Rockbank railway station|railway station]] is on the [[Melton railway line|Melton line]]. Rockbank is also served by the Route {{MetlinkBus|numtext=yes|route=456}} bus that runs along the [[Western Freeway (Victoria)|Western Freeway]], linking Melton and [[Sunshine, Victoria|Sunshine]]. The rich, red volcanic soil in the area has helped build the reputation of local [[wineries]]. Rockbank is also the host to Victoria's Annual [[Olive]] Festival. The earlier agricultural activities date back to the pastoral exploits of [[William Cross Yuille]] on the plains.<ref>{{cite Australasia|Yuille, William Crosse}}</ref> The town has an [[Australian rules football]] team competing in the [[Riddell District Football League]]. Koori Elder Steven Hanning also play for the side and are respected elders of the rockbank community. Steven also coaches the women c-grade netball team. ==See also== {{commons category}} * [[Kororoit Creek]] * [[Kororoit Creek Trail]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Shire of Melton suburbs}} [[Category:Suburbs of Melbourne]] {{Melbourne-geo-stub}}
